title: Drawing, "Two window cases", 1750–1800
medium: Graphite, pen and ink, brush and gray watercolor on laid paper
markings: watermark: bird over triple mount in circle; on top a heart form with A M C; below F
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors
description: Above: pediment is circular with an angularly broken base. In the interval between the window frame and the base is a keystone from which a garland hangs. A first design of the pediment has been made invalid. Below, the scheme is the same as above. The window frame is surrounded by a panel with pillars laterally supporting an entablature, straight above the capitals then curved upward. On top is a pointed pediment with a sphere upon a base above the straight part. In front of the keystone is a female head with drapery hanging down.

tombstone.epitaph: Drawing, "Two window cases", 1750–1800. Graphite, pen and ink, brush and gray watercolor on laid paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors. 1901-39-657.
